block.p: * Air Midwest Inc., an airline based in Wichita, Kan., said it had accepted an offer of $8 a share made by Mesa Airlines Inc., Farmington., N.M. * Baroid Corp., Houston, a drilling services and equipment company, said it had agreed to acquire Diamond Boart Stratabit S.A. from Diamond Boart S.A. of Belgium and Sanvik A.B., Sanviken, Sweden, for $70 million in cash and five-year warrants to buy two million Baroid shares at $7.875 each. * CIT Group Holdings Inc., New York, a subsidiary of Dai-Ichi Kangyo Bank and the Manufacturers Hanover Corp., announced that the Federal Reserve had approved its planned acquisition of Fidelcor Business Credit Corp., the commercial finance unit of First Fidelity Bancorp., Lawrenceville, N.J. * Delphax Systems, Randolph, Mass., a printing technology concern, said it had acquired the Imaging Systems division, in Hopkinton, Mass., of Avery Dennison, Pasadena, Calif. * Hamilton Standard, Windsor Locks, Conn., a unit of United Technologies Corp., plans to reduce its work force by 550 people. The reductions -- about 5 percent of its 13,000-member work force -- will be through layoffs, voluntary resignations and retirements. * RTZ Corp., London, said its Capper Pass & Son Ltd. tin smelter unit is to close in the next six months, with the loss of 489 jobs at the plant.
